channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1761] The 9 Stupidest Things Americans Believe
item.description: As polls will show, Americans are dumb. The sooner we accept this, the better.

item.title: [+1482] Stripping ChatRoulette Girl Turns Into She-Demon [VIDEO]
item.description: Watch all these guys, looking idiotic at the sight of this pretty girl stripping for them, until she turns into she-devil. I haven't enjoyed a ChatRoulette trick this much since the snake vs baby chicken flashing boob trick.

item.title: [+1354] Being Cool Has Two Rules You Must Remember (PIC)
[+1114] I Wonder if this Was in the Brochure. [Pic]
[+1056] Five Guys Burgers Dethrones In-N-Out as Top Burger
item.description: Five Guys Burgers has been gaining in popularity in recent years, and for those who eat the burgers - there's no surprise there. What is a surprise of readers of the Zagat Survey though, is that Five Guys Burgers wasn't even in the top 5 burgers last year...

item.title: [+781] Please cure my daddy (COMIC)
[+721] 'From Dust' Tech Demo is Phenomenal
item.description: Eric Chahi the man behind critically acclaimed games like Out of This World and Heart of Darkness, is now back to video games development with ‘From Dust’.

item.title: [+659] 8 Movie Sex Cliches That Never Happen in Real Life
item.description: Any mention of movie sex invariably conjures images of two (or more) inconceivably attractive Hollywood superstars pitch-perfectly wailing and undulating in slow-motion deployments that exceed our most ambitious fantasies—let alone our realities. Real sex isn't nearly as lame as it is in movies.

item.title: [+631] Mullet Pants (PIC)
item.description: These are going to be all the rage with the cool kids

item.title: [+605] Don't worry I will catch you if you fall (Pic)
[+592] Women March Topless for Legal Right to Go Topless - NSFW
item.description: Women in nine U.S. cities -- Seattle, New York, Chicago, Miami, Los Angeles, Denver, Honolulu, San Francisco and Austin, Texas -- will gather in public spots on Aug. 22 to put the hot-button issue front and center by wearing little more than strategically placed stickers.

item.title: [+574] Germany Ready To Legalize Medical Marijuana
item.description: Medical marijuana will soon be available in Germany, with the center-right coalition preparing to make major changes to the country's drug laws, a government health spokeswoman said this week.

item.title: [+553] U.S. Muslim leaders condemn Holocaust denial
item.description: U.S. officials participated in a trip of eight Muslim-American clerics to the sites of the former Dachau and Auschwitz concentration camps last week in what one official called a transformative experience. The imams issue a statement condemning anti-Semitism, Holocaust denial, and religious bigotry.

item.title: [+544] Apple may be looking to lock out unauthorized iOS users
item.description: Apple has applied for a patent on a method to protect mobile devices from unauthorized access, including automatic data wiping, alerting the device owner of trouble, and photographing and geolocating an "unauthorized" user.

item.title: [+502] Coolest Bears I have ever Seen! (GIF)
[+499] Chatroulette Users Encounter Surprise Exorcism (vid)
item.description: Either Lionsgate found some really good actors or the civilians engaged in these Chatroulette exchanges with a pretty girl are genuinely freaked out.

item.title: [+465] Live-action Metroid: Other M Commercial Revealed
item.description: Nintendo has released the T.V. ad for Metroid: Other M, which is one of the company's better commercials. It features live acting by Samus as well as some gameplay.

item.title: [+460] Could this be the dumbest forum post ever? [IMAGE]
item.description: gotta feel sorry for the guy...

item.title: [+457] In Murfreesboro, Tenn.: Church 'Yes,' Mosque 'No'
item.description: Local Muslims want to build a church next to a Baptist Church but somehow things just keep getting in the way.

item.title: [+456] 5 Bizarre Ways Your Siblings Made You Who You Are
item.description: Statistics say about 80 percent of you out there have at least one brother or sister. That's turning out to be hugely important, as science says whether or not you have siblings, and what order you were born in, has massive effects on who you are. Often not so great ones to boot.
